data.title: Needs help
data.text: Based on the Chow Mien - it's one n done for us. Basic average faire - not bad just nothing to write home about.

data.title: Chow mein   needs a lot of help
data.text: Seven friends decided to go here after a movie, 5 of us had the Chow mein, the other 2 had something else.  We 5 only had chow mein, because there are very few choices if you don't like HOt-SPICY stuff.   We all agreed that there were a lot of cheap noodles, hardly any vegetables,only a few tossed in, and very DRY slivered chicken.  The sauce wasn't bad, but the noodles soaked it up.   Not any reason to come back here!

data.title: Delicious!!!
data.text: I LOVE Pei Wei.....I especially love the fact that you can have an awesome WW meal here.  Healthy as healthy can be.  STEAMED with sauce on the side....X-tra veggie....lettuce cups instead of rice.  A+

data.title: Husband loves kung pao chicken!
data.text: It's kind of bland food to me but my husband always wants their kung pao chicken with fried rice.  He says it's his favorite "fast food"...the place is always clean and busy (not crowded though).

data.title: Just average
data.text: This is an American Asian restaurant with a different style of order and service. It is like stepping up to the counter at any fast-food restaurant. You pay and wait for the food to be delivered to your table, July 2016 is the 2nd time I went there and I wasn't impressed either time. Food was weak in flavor and service is limited to bringing you your order and cleaning off the table. There was no trash barrel near the door, so the trash in my hand had to be brought back to the table to be disposed of. I didn't think that was right, but was the way it was.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Website and Trip Advisor said open at 10:30am. Pull up open at 11.  Doors are dirty as are the bathrooms,  bottles of soy sauce etc.  Disgusting.  No white rice when they were open.  Only option was brown rice.  Unhappy staff are not communicating at all. Not coming back anytime soon... Disappointed but not surprised.  Been like this for some time.  Been awhile since we ate here for this very reason.  Nothing has changed

data.title: Disappointing Vietnamese Rice Noodle Salad
data.text: These chain restaurants always seem to be clean and usually the food is acceptable, if not as good as a "real" Asian restaurant.  However, I had the Vietnamese Rice Noodle Salad today - a new item on their menu - and it was not good.  The vinagrette was excessive in quantity & spicy flavor.  The chicken was dry and coated with a seasoning I did not care for.  I wish I had returned it.  Pei Wei needs to take this dish off their menu or do it right.  In the future, I will only be taking my business to a real Pho restaurant for real vermicelli noodle salad.

data.title: Excellent Dining Experience
data.text: This restaurant is absolutely excellent when it comes to service, cleanliness, and the taste of its foods.  They are very well priced and the time it takes to get your order is kept to a minimum.  I would recommend anyone to give them a try and I think you'll find that you like it.  On my scale of 1 - 10, I give them a 9.  They are very, very, good.

data.title: Always good
data.text: The food is always fresh.  I think it has good lunch portions.  If you get the larger portion you have left overs for dinner.

data.title: Delicious, if a bit saucy!
data.text:
Finally we have a night out during vacation when the dogs aren't with us! My boyfriend and I went along with two others to this casual but funky Chinese restaurant. 

You order at a counter and then they bring it out to you. The service was fast the night we were there, and we got our food quickly.

I loved my entree, the Ginger Broccoli Chicken with white rice, but it was DROWNING in sauce. None of my dinner mates had the same issue, so whoever served mine was probably just heavy handed with the ladle! I basically couldn't eat the rice, because it was saturated. I did eat all of the chicken and broccoli though, because despite being overly sauced, it was quite tasty, and just like I thought it would do, it settled my overly fast food consuming stomach!

I would return, and I wish they had a Pei Wei where I live, because I would go to it for sure!

data.title: Better Chinese than Most
data.text: This is a place that has kept it's food business simple.  You step up and place your order, receive all the dining help you need, pay your bill, get your own drinks, find your seat and your fantastic tasting meals will be brought to your table.  You can ask now or later when someone checks on you, if you need anything else.  Extra Sauce, etc.  This is some of the finest Chinese you will eat and you are not in a Buffet.  Your meal is prepared after you order it.  It comes to your table steaming hot and as I said "Delicious".  On my scale of 1 - 10, they have earned a very high grade of  9.  Give them a try, they are good.

data.title: Awesome!
data.text: One of our favorites when in AZ.  consistently good!  My favorites are the Asian chicken salad and classic chicken wrap

data.title: New Owners maybe? SLOW serivce
data.text:
We have been here a few times but this month (last week) we stopped in for a quick bite before the movies. Well it was over an hour before we got our food. The time you order is printed right on your receipt. This is a fast-food place.... so that wait was horrendous and we missed the movie.
After that long wait my rice was cold and the meal "warm" and in the past it was steaming hot - so hot I had to wait to ear it. It wasn't just us. We looked around and the only people being served were those with appetizers. There were 7 chefs working. (You can see them) 
When we asked to speak to the manager after an hour, our food suddenly arrived right ahead of him coming to our table. We explained that to wait over an hour in this place was too long (at the time I didn't yet realize the food wasn't hot)
He just stood there like a dummy. No apology. Said nothing. A stand off until he said "well what do you want" - At no time was there any "I'm sorry" or explanation.
We could only assume there was a HUGE take-out order that had come in and had priority over those who came to eat. Whatever, there was no apology. 
Is this place under new management?

data.title: Great spot for lunch!!
data.text: Very tasty food with a variety of items to choose from!  I love the Pad Thai Noodle dish and also the honey chicken!!

data.title: Now this is Chinese Food
data.text: Forget you ever went to Panda Express and try this authentic Chinese Restaurant.  Their menu is very good and the food is even better.  When your food is brought your table it is hot and ready to eat.  If you need any thing extra, just tell the folks who delivered your meal and they will take care of whatever you need.  I suggest you go early and enjoy your meal.  You will probably have plenty of food left over so they have plenty of containers for you to take home whatever.  On my scale of 1 - 10 they get a well deserved 9. The food quality is even better than the food quantity. Give them a try, If you like Chinese food, you will enjoy eating here.

data.title: Pretty Fast Chinese Food & Good Quality & Prices
data.text: You walk in, you see all your food options on the wall, you order your food, you find a seat, you display your order number and the friendly staff delivers your food in a timely manner.  Soft drinks are self-serve.

data.title: Not for romance,but great food!
data.text:
For over two years have driven pass this restaurant,but after an appointment 
my husband and I chose to eat lunch there and found the food delicious.
Returning a month later for supper we also found the food delicious even though
different entrees.
Not for romance,but great food.Be warned dining area is noisey and when we return will dine outside if weather permits since it is quieter.

data.title: Best Chinese meal in the last 7 years.
data.text: We went to Pei Wei and I had one of the best Chinese Meals in the past 7 years.  I had Sweet and Sour Shrimp over Fried Rice with pineapple and peas in the shell.  A small amount of Soy Sauce and it was awesome.  The food is always freshly cooked and brought to your table immediately.  The four of us had extremely great meals.  If you go early during non-snowbird season, you can avoid a crowd. Very clean restaurant and a very friendly staff to serve you. They even have sizes of meals that you can order. Small for the light eater and original for those who want to take home a baggie.  Try it.

data.title: PF Changs but cheaper
data.text:
Great place to get the delicious tates of PF Changs for a lot less.
Purfect for a quick dinner or lunch, less formal than PF Changs.

data.title: My way is Pei Wei!
data.text: Always crowded and I'm sure it's because food is always good and  served promptly. Love it when I call on my way home from work to order "to go"...and they KNOW it's me! I'm loyal! Food is always ready at time promised. Sometimes I order extra meet  for entree. It only is a nominal charge to do that. Love the chicken lettuce wrap with a side of hot and sour soup.
